item.description:
Is crate architecture a trendy fad or a viable building type?

More than 50 years ago, the introduction of shipping crates transformed the transportation industry by lowering freight costs and improving the transport of goods all over the world. Though they reaped glories for the trade industries, their innate value has been short-lived as they are often abandoned after use. Today, sustainability and affordability concerns have created new life for the shipping crate in the realm of architecture. The incredibly sturdy, though quite simple, rectangular shape is now housing for family, an inspirational art studio, a retail store and so much more.

Although there are many successful examples of crate architecture, can shipping crates really become a new building type or are they another trend that will soon ride away with the tide?

The BSA's Emerging Professionals Network and PUMA host "The New Wave: Crate Architecture," a panel discussion on May 4 at 6:00 pm at the PUMA mobile store that will be in Boston from April 26 to May 16 as part of the Volvo Ocean Race.
